oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Special Field Order No. 114 appointing Captain J. P. Baltzell Provost Marshal at Augusta, Georgia
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Military Police; Military orders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is Special Field Order No. 114, issued by General John Hood, relieving Captain J. P. Baltzell from duty at Opelika, Alabama, and assigning him to duty as Provost Marshal at Augusta, Georgia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- Adjutant and Inspector-General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Special orders are comprised of commands related to specific actions to be taken within the units of troops specified in the order. Such orders can involve movements, actions, and transfers. The Provost Marshal commands the Military Police.
